DOC.brief_summary: The registry includes patients undergoing cardiovascular and thoracic surgery at the Saarland University Medical Center, Homburg/Saar, Germany. This study is a monocentric, retrospective study investigating the development of NOMI and outcome of patients.
DOC.brief_title: Registeranalysis for the Examination of NOMI
DOC.detailed_description: All data were acquired from the hospital electronic health record and the picture archiving computer system (PACS). NOMI was suspected if the following clinical signs occured: new onset of oliguria (urine output <0.5 mL/kg/hour for at least 6 hours) or anuria, abdominal distention with decreased or absent bowel sounds, elevated serum lactate levels >5.0mmol/L or metabolic acidosis (base excess <-5mmol/L). In accordance to the definition of cardiogenic shock angiography was performed in patients with a systolic blood pressure >90 mmHg and a cardiac index >1.8 L/minute/mÂ².
DOC.criteria: The investigators include anonymous data from patients with cardiothoracic surgery
